name: fastq-dump

options.description: Replaces accession derived from <path> in filename(s) and deflines (only for single table dump)
Table name within cSRA object, default is "SEQUENCE"
Split spots into individual reads
Minimum spot id
Maximum spot id
Filter by SPOT_GROUP (member): name[,...]
Remove adapter sequences from reads
Filter by sequence length >= <len>
Split into files by READ_FILTER value [split], optionally filter by value: [pass|reject|criteria|redacted]
Filter used in early 1000 Genomes data: no sequences starting or ending with >= 10N
Filter used in current 1000 Genomes data
Dump only aligned sequences
Dump only unaligned sequences
Filter by position on genome. Name can eiter by accession.version (ex: NC_000001.10) or file specific name (ex: "chr1" or "1". "from" and "to" are 1-based coordinates
Filter by distance between matepairs. Use "unknown" to find matepairs split between the references. Use from-to to limit matepair distance on the same reference
Dump only biological reads
Output directory, default is working directory '.'
Output to stdout, all split data become joined into single stream
Compress output using gzip: deprecated, not recommended
Compress output using bzip2: deprecated, not recommended

Write reads into separate files. Read number will be suffixed to the file name. NOTE! The `--split-3` option is recommended. In cases where not all spots have the same number of reads, this option will produce files that WILL CAUSE ERRORS in most programs which process split pair fastq files.

3-way splitting for mate-pairs. For each spot, if there are two biological reads satisfying filter conditions, the first is placed in the `*_1.fastq` file, and the second is placed in the `*_2.fastq` file. If there is only one biological read satisfying the filter conditions, it is placed in the `*.fastq` file.All other reads in the spot are ignored.
Split into files by SPOT_GROUP (member name)
Split into subdirectories instead of files
Do not delete empty files
Formats sequence using color space (default for SOLiD), "cskey" may be specified for translation or else specify "dflt" to use the default value
Formats sequence using base space (default for other than SOLiD).
FASTA only, no qualities, with can be "default" or "0" for no wrapping
suppress quality-value for cskey
Defline contains only original sequence name
Append read id after spot id as 'accession.spot.readid' on defline
Helicos style defline
Defline format specification for sequence.

Defline format specification for quality. <fmt> is string of characters and/or variables. The variables can be one of: $ac - accession, $si spot id, $sn spot name, $sg spot group (barcode), $sl spot length in bases, $ri read number, $rn read name, $rl read length in bases. '[]' could be used for an optional output: if all vars in [] yield empty values whole group is not printed. Empty value is empty string or for numeric variables. Ex: @$sn[_$rn]/$ri '_$rn' is omitted if name is empty
<path> to ngc file
<path> to permission file
location in cloud
<path> to cart file
disable multithreading
Display the version of the program
Increase the verbosity of the program status messages. Use multiple times for more verbosity.
Logging level as number or enum string. One of (fatal|sys|int|err|warn|info|debug) or (0-6) Current/default is warn
Read more options and parameters from the file.
print this message

tldr:
> Extracts data in FASTQ- or FASTA-format from SRA accessions.

- Download the SRA data that has accession SRR1553607.

`fastq-dump {{SRR1553607}}`

- Download the first 10,000 reads of the SRA data.

`fastq-dump --split-files -X 10000 {{SRR1553607}}`
